heaviest_rainfall.status: On 09 November 2025, a record rainfall of 47.89mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  24.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 34.3mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 24.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 47.89mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 02 February 2026, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 3 cold snaps, usually there are 3.6 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 0 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (203°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 128.2 mph from 27 January 2026.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.1°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and little or no wind. Showers, occasional overcast conditions, and weak sunlight because of clouds. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
